circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance:
On July 25, 1992, Cathy Hicks Parrott was reported missing. She was last seen by her family at approximately 22.00 on July 23rd at their residence in Tara Village in Florence, SC. 

Cathy's vehicle was recovered on the morning of July 24, 1992 in the East Florence area after having been in a hit and run accident. A black male was seen running from the vehicle. The black male has been located but knows nothing of Cathy's disappearance.

It is not known what happened to Cathy. But, the circumstances of her disappearance are extremely suspicious and warrant the suspicion of foul play. Several intensive searches have been made to locate Cathy with negative results

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance:
Sanders has not been heard from since June 19, 2001, when he called his family and said he was on his way home from Columbia, South Carolina. He was seen was around 9:51 p.m. at the Embassy Suites in Columbia, SC where he was planning a bachelor party for a friend. The phone call Shelton placed to his family in Rembert, SC was from his mobile phone. Police are saying that neither his cell phone nor his credit cards have been used since his disappearance.

In April 2003, the 1988 Oldsmobile Regency Sanders was driving the night he vanished turned up in the parking lot at Greenbrier Apartments in Northeast Columbia. Police believe it had been abandoned since Shelton's disappearance.

On October 5, 2005, the police arrested 30-year-old Mark Anthony Richardson. He was charged with murder and taken to the Richland County Jail. He was the last person with Shelton while he was alive.

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance:
Officials have found the campsite of a Westminster man reported missing in the Sumter National Forest during the weekend. Mack Webb's campsite appeared to have been vacant for several days, Oconee County Emergency Preparedness Director Henry Gordon said Monday. Webb, 45, had been camping alone in the forest, near the North Carolina line, since Wednesday. ``At this point, we don't suspect foul play,''county Sheriff James Singleton said. "There are some slits in the tent, but we don't know if he cut the tent to let air in or if it was vandalized."

State, local and federal authorities searched the forest and the Chauga River for six hours Monday, using all-terrain vehicles, a kayak and an airplane. Deputies were talking to Mr. Webb's friends to determine if anyone had seen him or knew where he might have gone, Sheriff Gordon said.

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance:
Last seen by neighbors at the Churchill Place Apartments complex in Columbia, South Carolina on August 15, 2003. Richardson resided at Churchill Apartments in the 4900 block of Fairfield Road at the time. She has never been heard from again. Her sister reported her missing on October 10. 
Richardson's teal green 1994 Ford Mustang was recovered in         St. Mary's, Georgia in October 2003. Her husband's sister (Anita's sister-in-law) was driving it. Richardson and her husband also owned a red 1987 Toyota pickup truck and a gray 1992 Chevrolet Lumina. Authorities believe Richardson could have been taken against her will. After August, the couple failed to pay the rent and was served with two eviction notices. The husband was gone by then, leaving most of her belongings behind including clothes, tv, vcr, a mattress and a refrigerator full of food.
Nedd walked away from his apartment on Zimalcrest Drive. He has not made contact with his family since April 28, 2003.

On March 30, 2006 Linnell C. Young was reported to the Richland County Sheriff's Department as a missing person. He was last seen by his family on March 28, 2006 around 5:30 p.m. at his residence on Virginia Byrd Rd., in Eastover. Mr. Young was ill and told his mother he was going to bed. When she returned to his home on Wednesday morning, the 29th, at 7:00a.m., she found his front door standing open and Mr.. Young was nowhere in the residence. Investigators have talked with his employer and found that he has not been at work since the 28th nor has he picked up his paycheck. 
It is not known what Linnell Young was last wearing; however, he almost always wears a baseball cap.

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance:
Crockett was seen last at Rankin's Grocery on U.S. 521 in Taylor's Grove some time after 7 p.m. August 12, 1977. 
People at a house nearby said he was talking with someone inside a car that was parked in the median on U.S. 521. But nobody knows where he went after that. 
The Lancaster County Sheriff's Office began a search of the surrounding area that weekend.

On 11/16/2003 the victim's sister saw the victim at 6:30pm, and said he was acting odd. On 11/17/2003 the sister returned to the victim's residence and found the back door un-locked. She could not find the victim and called the Sheriff's Office. Investigators found pry marks on the door. Two small appliances were damaged, and someone defected on the floor, and on a bed. All of these factor indicated possible foul play, or at least the victim could have come to some kind of harm. An extensive search including blood hounds, and aerial support was conducted, but the victim was not found.

Carver was last seen during the evening hours of June 16, 1998 in Seneca, South Carolina. She was inside her residence at the B&B Trailer Park in the Utica community at the time. Carver has never been heard from again. She purchased a new vehicle prior to her disappearance, but the car was discovered parked near her home on the following morning. Her family members reported her as a missing person on June 20. 
Carver's loved ones said that it is uncharacteristic of her to leave without warning. Her disappearance is considered suspicious and her relatives are concerned foul play was involved. Carver's case remains unsolved

She was accompanied by her three puppies and an adult German Shepherd. Two of the dogs returned to her home shortly after she disappeared, but there was no sign of Miller. 
An extensive search of the surrounding areas produced no clues as to Miller's whereabouts. All of her personal belongings were located inside of her residence, including her dentures, walking stick, her purse with cash inside, and her eyeglasses. There was no sign of a struggle at the house.

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance:
Jones was last seen with his friend, Toby Bing, at approximately 6:30 p.m. in the 100 block of Wild Horse Road on Hilton Head Island, South Carolina on February 18, 1999. Jones was visiting from Atlanta, Georgia at the time. Bing received a call on his cellular phone while away from his residence during the day. The caller requested that Bing drive to Bluffton, South Carolina. They were driving Bing's white 1994 Toyota pickup truck at the time of their disappearances. Neither Bing nor Jones has been heard from again. 
Bing's vehicle was discovered abandoned in Savannah, Georgia on February 24, 1999, six days after he and Jones vanished. There was no sign of either man at the scene. Authorities discovered a large amount of blood at the Bluffton residence of Sean Rico Sullivan sometime afterwards. DNA tests confirmed that the blood was Bing's.

Zachary Malinowski was playing basketball in Aynor with friends on Sunday, August 25, 2013. After playing ball, he dropped off one of his friends at a residence on Murray Johnson Road in Conway, South Carolina. The other friend states that he and Malinowski then went to a  woman's residence  on 7th Avenue in Aynor, South Carolina. They both stayed at that residence until approximately 11:30 p.m. The friend states that Malinowski left in Malinowski's car, a 1996 dark purple/burgundy Chevy Beretta to get something to eat and go home. He hasn’t been seen since. The last phone contact was approximately 12:15AM on 08/26/13. 

Horry County police later found Malinowski's car in the woods off of Valley Forge Road near Aynor. The car was completely burned and there was no sign of Malinowski.

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance:
Bing told his family that he planned to move furniture during the day of February 18, 1999 in his hometown of Hilton Head Island, South Carolina. He received a call on his cellular phone while away from his residence shortly thereafter. The caller requested that Bing drive to Bluffton, South Carolina. Bing was accompanied by his friend, El Shawndrae Jones, at the time. Both men were last seen at approximately 6:30 p.m. in the 100 block of Wild Horse Road. They were driving Bing's white 1994 Toyota pickup truck at the time of their disappearances. Neither Bing or Jones has been heard from again. 
Bing's vehicle was discovered abandoned in Savannah, Georgia on February 24, 1999, six days after he and Jones vanished. There was no sign of either man at the scene. Authorities discovered a large amount of blood at the Bluffton residence sometime afterwards. DNA tests confirmed that the blood was Bing's.

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: Frankie was last heard from on Mothers Day 1989 when she called her adopted mother. Frankie had traveled from South Carolina to Kansas with a female friend (name unknown.) She called her brother in Harrisonburg, VA to see if they could stay with him for a few days before going back to SC.  Her friend, Bob/Robert in Kansas who she and her friend had been staying with, had been on the road (as a truck driver) and when he returned, her mother in SC called him and he told her that Frankie and her friend had already headed back.  No communication with any family member has been made since then.  Whereabouts were unknown.  Circumstances regarding her disappearance are also unknown.  She traveled a lot, often hitchhiking to various states such as FL, VA, KS, OH, SC, though rumors say she may have gone to CA and/or AZ at one point as well.  Nothing substantial has transpired or been validated with Frankie since 1989.  Most addresses found had no date provided at all.  She has family in both VA and SC.  She gave birth to children in SC and KS.  None of her children have heard from her either.

vehicles.comment: Often known to hitchhike especially at truck stops.

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance:
Korrina Lynne Sagers Malinoski was last seen on or about November 21, 1987.  She was reported missing by her employer after failing to show for work.  The employer had located her automobile locked and parked at the gate of the Mount Holly Plantation.  Korrina's husband worked as a caretaker and lived in a cabin on the 6000 acre plantation with Korrina and their children along with Korina's daughter from a prior marriage (see Annette Deanne Sagers entry - MP6614).  The husband indicated that Korrina had left the night before between 11 and 11:30 saying she was going for a ride.

Police and state law enforcement conducted searches on the property.  Korrina has not had contact with her blood relative in the interim.  

Annette Deanne Sagers, Korrina's daughter, went missing a year later possibly  at a bus stop on the road outside the plantation.

On September 18, 2017 Kenneth Jenkins was reported missing by his family; they had not heard from him since September 16, 2017. On the evening of the sixteenth he took a friend to dinner and after dinner dropped the friend off. After dinner he said he had to give another friend a ride to Ridgeland which is in Jasper county. The next day his car was found burned with four bullet holes to the driver side door. Kenneth has never been located.
